function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Wearable devices and unobtrusive sensing technologies may not accurately monitor early symptoms of COVID-19 or common health conditions, leading to misdiagnosis or delayed treatment.","Impact":"Mismanagement of early symptoms of COVID-19 or other health conditions, potential spread of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Validation of the accuracy and reliability of wearable devices through clinical trials and research studies, regular updates and improvements to the sensing technologies, education and training for users on the limitations of wearables.","Technologies":"Clinical trials, research studies, continuous improvement in sensing technologies, user education and training.","People":"Individuals using wearable devices for health monitoring, healthcare professionals relying on wearable data for diagnosis and treatment.","Owner":"Healthcare institutions, technology developers, regulatory bodies."},{"Description":"Role of cloud, edge, and fog computing in telehealth monitoring systems may pose security and privacy risks for the sensitive health data transmitted and stored.","Impact":"Unauthorized access, breaches, or leaks of sensitive health data, compromising patient privacy and confidentiality.","Mitigation":"Implementation of robust encryption and security measures, compliance with data protection regulations, regular security audits and updates, user awareness and training on data security best practices.","Technologies":"Encryption and security protocols, data protection regulations, security audits, user education and training.","People":"Patients using telehealth monitoring systems, healthcare providers and administrators responsible for data security and privacy.","Owner":"Healthcare institutions, technology providers, data security professionals."},{"Description":"Wearable devices used for maintaining social distancing and contact tracing may raise concerns about data privacy and surveillance.","Impact":"Invasion of personal privacy, potential misuse or unauthorized access to location and contact data, public distrust in the use of wearables for COVID-19 prevention.","Mitigation":"Transparent communication on data collection and usage, strict adherence to data protection laws, anonymization of location and contact data, user consent and opt-in policies.","Technologies":"Anonymization techniques, data protection regulations, user consent mechanisms, transparent communication practices.","People":"Individuals using wearables for social distancing and contact tracing, general public concerned about privacy implications.","Owner":"Public health authorities, technology developers, privacy advocacy groups."}]}
